intro: Coniogramme spinulosa, commonly known as the spiny coniogramme, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender peduncles. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its unique foliage and compact growth habit make it a popular choice for indoor gardening and ornamental purposes.
